availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Ky.
McCracken County } sct

John W Scales having been brought before me by virtue of a warrant issued by Thos E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky -- and I being satisfied from the statement of the prisoner and the testimony of Henry Clark and J. S. Ogilvie, that the prisoner is the identical person refered to in said warrant as being charged with the crime of Murder in the State of Tennessee Therefore the said prisoner John W. Scales is ordered to be delivered to the said Henry W. Clark to be by him taken to the State of Tennessee in accordance with the said warrant of the Governor -- to be then dealt with according to law --
Witness C, S, Marshall Judge of the 1st Circuit Court Judicial District of Kentucky this 3d day of November 1865

Commonwealth
vs } Order of Judge
Jno W. Scales
